questions.question: What is the principle behind the operation of a vibrating tube density sensor?
Which factor can affect the accuracy of a density sensor in a real-world application?
In the context of density sensors, what is calibration, and why is it important?

answers.a: Adjusting the sensor to a known standard; ensures accurate measurements
answers.b: Cleaning the sensor components; enhances durability
answers.c: Upgrading the sensor firmware; improves performance
answers.d: Changing the sensor's physical structure; adapts to different substances

questions.difficulty: Adjusting the sensor to a known standard; ensures accurate measurements

questions.question: Which type of density sensor is commonly used in the food and beverage industry for quality control?
What role does temperature compensation play in a density sensor?

answers.a: Adjusts measurements based on substance color
answers.b: Accounts for variations in substance viscosity
